title: One of my Gmail accounts stopped working with Thunderbird
content:
When I open Thunderbird, I get this error message: "The STAT command did not succeed. Error getting message number and sizes. Mail server pop.googlemail.com responded: [AUTH] Invalid credentials."

I can not receive or send emails on Thunderbird with a particular email address, however if I use another email address, it works without errors. When I attempt to send an email, I get this error message, "Login to server smtp.googlemail.com with username (Redacted) failed." Or the following error message occurs, "Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.googlemail.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'."

I have followed all of the instructions for setting up the Oauth token and allowing cookies and Java script, but without success. This problem started when I received an email from Google saying that I needed to validate my account for security reasons. When they asked me to enter my account's password, I failed to do it correctly because they would not allow me to paste it in and they would not show the characters which I was typing in as anything but dots. The result was that they indicated that they were invalidating my account because of too many failed attempts to log on to my Google account. I have since then been able to log on there, but they offer no help in recovering the operation of my email account on Thunderbird. Incidentally, this troubled email account works okay on the Google Email internet site, just not with Thunderbird.

Any help that you can provide will be much appreciated!
creator: lee7326892

title: How do I uninstall v115?
content:
V115 changed significantly how it looks and how the menus work. Which is now interfering with the way I work. How do I revert to the previous v102 appearance?

Previously, I had the Thunderbird window in one corner of my screen, and all the toolbar controls that I use could be seen. Now to see all the toolbar controls that I use, I have to have the Thunderbird window twice the size. How is this an improvement?

Also, why do you push a version update and not update the help information to the new version?
creator: gmkapus

title: URGENT: How to search and copy (not move) found messages to new folder?
content:
I have to search for key words in folders with 500-1,000 emails each. Then I need to copy the resulting emails to a new folder where I can review them later for submission in a legal discovery request.

I seems like this used to be straightforward. I'd search, get a list of found emails, and I could then just copy them to a new folder. When I just tried this, everything seemed to have changed. My options are now to Move the found emails to a different folder or to Save as Search Folder, which doesn't help me at all.

If I move the emails to a new folder, I have lost the integrity of my original folder.

Please advise? I find it hard to believe that there is no longer any way to copy over search results.
creator: rbrook1

title: Last upgrade of Thunderbird to my Linux computer is not working properly
content:
At the beginning of October - I believe or thereabouts, my computer received an update of Thunderbird which almost literally exploded on my computer. By exploded, I mean that the size of the screen is larger than my computer screen (computer screen actual size: 1920 wide by 1080 high). Worse still, the update has limited my scrolling so that I cannot scroll to reach parts of the program that are off-screen. (Please note that my descriptions are not technical, but how it appears to me as I am limited by whatever is wrong with the Thunderbird program update.)

On the version of Thunderbird I had before the update, I had set the size of the screen font to 20pts, picas, whatever (because I have aging vision). After the update, I did find the setting for the size of print and put it at its lowest setting 9pts. It reduced the size of the onscreen print somewhat, but not to 9pts. When I look at 9 pts in my wordprocessor, the print is duly small.

To compare what I see on the Thunderbird screen with what I see in my wordprocessor, Libre Write, I took a screenshot of an email title and pasted it in my wordprocessor and then repeated the title at 14pts (the size I use when I write) at 9pts (the size I changed in Thuderbird), and 20 Pts (my original font-size with Thunderbird). Below you will find the screenshot so you can compare for youself.

So that's the first problem I have with this Thunderbird update.

The second problem I have is that scrolling has become limited, so while in the column that shows the email accouonts, you can see "Local Folders", but you can't scroll past Local Folders. This is a real problem for me because I subscribe to a number of newsletters and move them to folders I have created under Local folders. I do this to keep my email accounts from being over loaded. While I can transfer them automatically to the Local Folders, I can't access them because the program will not let me scroll past the Local Folders.

Because of the way this progam update works, I can't find/reach the Delete Account button that should be at the bottom of Account Settings, but since the scrolling stops at the Email Signature box and goes no further, I can't delete the account.

Why do I want to delete an account. Trying to work things out by myself, I thought I would remove three of my minor email accounts to another Linux mail app, and that I might then be able to scroll to the folders under the Local Folders and, at least, have a bare minimum functioning of Thunderbird.

I went through this whole thing with David, a top 10 contributor and he recommended i put the whole shebang up on this support list. But truthfully, I don't think this is something any user, no matter how expert, can help me with. This is truly a Thunderbird problem and I don't know how to reach Thunderbird technicians.

Please let me know if you have any ideas on how to get Thunderbird's attention. Any help is appreciated.
creator: bdjim

title: New version of Thunderbird
content:
I immediately ran into a problem with the new version of Thunderbird. I use 3 email accounts and the update erased and/or changed the password when sending a message. I received emails without a problem, but they would not transmit. A popup window appeared asking for a new password. Clicking on that only resent the message. I went to the saved passwords and was able to re-enter my passwords on these accounts. Using windows 10. Note that there were no problems with passwords on my Ipad.

One other problem. in the messages area (subject, correspondents, date), I cannot adjust the number of messages seen. I can expand it, but not reduce it. For instance, it currently shows 8 messages, but I cannot change it to 6, or 4. I did find that I could adjust the font size - thanks.

LIke others, I still prefer the previous version.

title: Can not print a DRAFT message open in compose window
content:
I routinely print messages right before I send them** and Thunderbird v115.3.2 doesn't let me do that. It acts like it's going to do it, but then nothing happens. I'm on a Mac, and if I choose "Save as PDF" from the PDF Services menu, literally nothing is saved. This tells me that Thunderbird is acting like it is going to print something, but doesn't actually pass anything to macOS to print.

If, I save it in Drafts and then go to the Drafts mailbox and print from there, it works as expected, but that's a lot of extra steps.

It seems this same bug happened a number of years ago: [Can no longer print a DRAFT message open in compose] and was classified as a bug and fixed. Hopefully the same can happen again?

Thanks!

    • OK, I don't print them, I save them as PDFs, but the workflow and problem is the same.

title: Emails not opening
content: I am using version 115.3.2 and have not had a problem until today. About 7:15 PM while reading through my emails, Thunderbird disappeared and I got a blue screen message that an error had occurred, but before I could read further, my PC went blank. The power light was still on, so I waited several minutes, but nothing was happening (no restart). I did a manual shutdown and rebooted. The system seemed to load normally. I went back to Thunderbird to pick up where I left off on the emails. The list of emails was there, but when I clicked on the next one in the queue, nothing happened. A double click opened a blank page, not the email. I checked a few others, and the same thing happened. This was with my main email account from Optimum. I checked my other accounts (AOL and gmail), and they appear unaffected; emails opened normally. I sent an email to the Optimum account from both of the others, and they opened normally. After some checking, this "blank page" situation seems to start with emails in the inbox from 9/21/2023 and continue to today (10/15/2023) at around 7:15 PM. Older emails are still there. I have many folders for old emails, and I checked several of them. The old emails are still there, including ones between 9/21 and 10/15. All the blank emails from today seem to be OK when downloaded on Windows Mail. I signed into my Optimum account online, and all the emails seem to be there. This all seems very strange. I would hope there is some way to repopulate these blank emails.
creator: hasmort
